intro: Oreopanax discolor, commonly known as the variegated arrowroot, is a tropical plant belonging to the Araliaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often variegated with white or yellow markings. It thrives in humid, warm environments and prefers well-drained soil. Oreopanax discolor is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage.
